{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fluoride in drinking water affects the development and mineralization of teeth. Primary teeth start to develop in utero and finish developing by the age of 3 years. Permanent teeth, except third molars, start developing in utero and finish by the age of 8 years. Third molars, also known as wisdom teeth, start developing around the age of 8-10 years. Therefore, if a child spends 8 years in a place with high fluoride in the water, it will affect all primary teeth and all permanent teeth, except third molars.", "answer_choice": "B. All permanent teeth, except third molars"}
